clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of Oral BAY63-2521 in Patients With CTEPH.
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Multi-centre, Multi-national Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Oral BAY63-2521 (1 mg, 1.5 mg, 2 mg, or 2.5 mg Tid) in Patients With Chronic Thromboembolic Pulmonary Hypertension (CTEPH)

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to assess the efficacy and safety of different doses of BAY63-2521, given orally for 16 weeks, in patients with Chronic Thromboembolic Pulmonary Hypertension (CTEPH).

detailed_description.textblock: Adverse event data will be covered in Adverse events section.

primary_outcome.measure: 6 Minutes Walking Distance (6MWD) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
primary_outcome.description: 6-minute walking distance (6MWD) is a measure for the objective evaluation of a participant's functional exercise capacity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pulmonary Vascular Resistance (PVR) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: The pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) is a calculated hemodynamic parameter. PVR is derived from the directly measured parameters mean pulmonary arterial pressure (PAPmean) and pulmonary capillary wedge pressure (PCWP), divided by the cardiac output (CO). PVR and PAPmean are acquired during a right heart catheterization. CO is a calculated hemodynamic parameter, too. Formula: PVR = 80*(PAPmean - PCWP)/CO

secondary_outcome.measure: N-terminal Prohormone of Brain Natriuretic Peptide (NT-proBNP) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: N-terminal pro-brain natriuretic peptide (NT-proBNP) levels in the blood are used for screening, diagnosis of acute congestive heart failure (CHF) and may be useful to establish prognosis in heart failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: World Health Organization (WHO) Functional Class - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: The WHO functional assessment of pulmonary arterial hypertension ranged from functional class I (Patients with PH but without resulting limitation of physical activity) to class IV (Patients with PH with inability to carry out any physical activity without symptoms. These patients manifest signs of right-heart failure.). Changes to a lower WHO functional class resemble improvement; changes to a higher functional class resemble deterioration of PAH.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Clinical Worsening
secondary_outcome.description: The combined endpoint "time to clinical worsening", made up of the following components, defined by the first occurrence: all-cause mortality; heart/lung transplantation; rescue endarterectomy; first hospitalization due to pulmonary hypertension; start of a new pulmonary hypertension treatment; persistent worsening of 6MWD or WHO functional class due to deterioration of PH.

secondary_outcome.measure: Borg CR 10 Scale - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: The Borg CR10 Scale is a participant reported outcome measure used in clinical diagnosis of e.g. breathlessness and dyspnea. It documents the participant's exertion during a physical test. Low values indicate low levels of exertion; high values indicate more intense exertion reported by the participant. The score ranges from 0 ("Nothing at all") to 10 ("Extremely strong - Maximal").

secondary_outcome.measure: EQ-5D Utility Score - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D utility score is a Quality-of-Life participant reported outcome measure. The utility score is calculated based on five questions concerning problems with mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort and anxiety/depression. An increase in the utility score represents an improvement in quality of life. The score ranges from -0.594 (worst answer in all five questions) to 1 (best answer in all five questions).

secondary_outcome.measure: Living With Pulmonary Hypertension (LPH) Questionnaire - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: The self-reported Living with Pulmonary Hypertension (LPH) questionnaire is designed to measure the effects of PH and PH-specific treatments on an individual's quality of life. The LPH total score can range from 0 (best) to 105 (worst).

other_outcome.measure: All Caused Mortality
other_outcome.description: All cause mortality (including cardiovascular mortality) was one component of the composite endpoint "time to clinical worsening".

other_outcome.measure: Mean Pulmonary Artery Pressure (PAPmean) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Mean pulmonary arterial pressure (PAPmean) is a directly measured hemodynamic parameter. PAPmean is recorded during a right heart catheterization.

other_outcome.measure: Cardiac Index (CI) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: The cardiac index (CI) is a calculated hemodynamic parameter. CI is derived from the directly measured parameters cardiac output (CO), divided by the body surface area (BSA). BSA is a calculated parameter, using the subject's height and weight in the DuBois formula. Formula: BSA = (W [kg]*0.425)*(H [cm]*0.725)*0.007184 (m^2)

other_outcome.measure: Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Systolic systemic arterial blood pressure (SBP) is a directly non-invasively measured hemodynamic parameter. Range allowed in this study at Visit 0 and/or Visit 1 before randomization: 95 - 180 mmHg.

other_outcome.measure: Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Diastolic systemic arterial blood pressure (DBP) is a directly non-invasively measured hemodynamic parameter. Range allowed in this study at Visit 0 and/or Visit 1 before randomization: <= 110 mmHg.

other_outcome.measure: Heart Rate (HR) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Heart rate (HR) is a directly non-invasively measured hemodynamic parameter. Range allowed in this study at Visit 0 and/or Visit 1 before randomization: 50 -105 beats per minute (bpm) at rest.

other_outcome.measure: Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) is a standard clinical chemistry parameter. Normal range: 0 to 45 U/L.

other_outcome.measure: Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST) is a standard clinical chemistry parameter. Normal range: 0 to 41 U/L.

other_outcome.measure: Alkaline Phosphatase (AP) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Alkaline phosphatase (AP) is a standard clinical chemistry parameter. Normal range: 40 to 129 U/L (males), 35 to 104 U/L (females)

other_outcome.measure: Bilirubin - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Bilirubin is a standard clinical chemistry parameter. Normal range: 0.1 to 1.2 mg/dL

other_outcome.measure: Creatinine - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Creatinine is a standard clinical chemistry parameter. Normal range: 0.25 to 1.20 mg/dL (males), 0.46 to 1.00 mg/dL (females)

other_outcome.measure: Creatinine Clearance - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Creatinine clearance is a standard clinical chemistry parameter. Normal range: 90 to 140 mL/min (males), 80 to 125 mL/min (females)

other_outcome.measure: Creatine Kinase (CK) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Creatine Kinase is a standard clinical chemistry parameter. Normal range: 35 to 232 U/L (males), 26 to 145 U/L (females)

other_outcome.measure: Erythrocytes (RBC) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Erythrocytes (red blood cells, RBC) is a standard clinical hematology parameter. Normal range: 4.6 to 5.8*10^12 cells/L (males), 4.1 to 5.2*10^12 cells/L (females)

other_outcome.measure: Leukocytes (WBC) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Leukocytes (white blood cells, WBC) is a standard clinical hematology parameter. Normal range: 4.0 to 10.7*10^9 cells/L

other_outcome.measure: Lymphocytes - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Total lymphocytes is a standard clinical hematology parameter. Normal range: 1.0 to 4.0*10^9 cells/L

other_outcome.measure: Neutrophils - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Neutrophils is a standard clinical hematology parameter. Normal range: 1.6 to 7.4*10^9 cells/L

other_outcome.measure: Hemoglobin - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Hemoglobin is a standard clinical hematology parameter. Normal range: 13.5 to 17.5 g/dL (males), 12.0 to 16.0 g/dL (females)

other_outcome.measure: Hematocrit - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Hematocrit is a standard clinical hematology parameter. Normal range: 40 to 52% (males), 36 to 46% (females)

other_outcome.measure: Potassium - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Potassium is a standard clinical chemistry parameter. Normal range: 3.5 to 5.3 mmol/L

other_outcome.measure: Urate - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Urate is a standard clinical chemistry parameter. Normal range: 4.0 to 8.5 mg/dL (males, 16-59 years), 3.4 to 8.7 mg/dL (males, >60 years) 2.5 to 7.5 mg/dL (females)

other_outcome.measure: Urea (BUN) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Urea (blood urea nitrogen, BUN) is a standard clinical chemistry parameter. Normal range: 4 to 25 mg/dL

other_outcome.measure: Cystatin C - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Cystatin C is a biomarker. Normal range: 0.53 to 1.01 ng/mL

other_outcome.measure: Triacylglycerol Lipase - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Triacylglycerol lipase is a standard clinical chemistry parameter. Normal range: 7 to 60 U/L

other_outcome.measure: Arterial Partial Pressure of Carbon Dioxide (PaCO2) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Arterial partial pressure of carbon dioxide (PaCO2) is performed as part of the capillary or arterial blood gas analysis. If possible, no supplementary oxygen was given during the resting period and while blood samples were drawn.

other_outcome.measure: Arterial Partial Oxygen Pressure (PaO2) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Arterial partial pressure of oxygen (PaO2) is performed as part of the capillary or arterial blood gas analysis. If possible, no supplementary oxygen was given during the resting period and while blood samples were drawn.

other_outcome.measure: Oxygen Saturation (SaO2) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Oxygen saturation (SaO2) is measured as part of the capillary or arterial blood gas analysis. Normal blood oxygen saturation is considered 95-100 percent. If possible, no supplementary oxygen was given during the resting period and while blood samples were drawn.

other_outcome.measure: Mean PR Duration (PRmean) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: PR duration was evaluated as part of the 12-lead electrocardiogram. electrocardiograms (ECGs) were recorded after the participant had been at rest for 15 minutes in a supine position.

other_outcome.measure: Mean QRS Duration (QRSmean) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: QRS duration was evaluated as part of the 12-lead electrocardiogram. ECGs were recorded after the participant had been at rest for 15 minutes in a supine position.

other_outcome.measure: Mean QT Duration (QTmean) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: QT duration was evaluated as part of the 12-lead electrocardiogram. ECGs were recorded after the participant had been at rest for 15 minutes in a supine position.

other_outcome.measure: Mean QTcB Duration (Bazett's Correction Formula, QTcB) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Bazett-corrected QTcB duration was evaluated as part of the 12-lead electrocardiogram. ECGs were recorded after the participant had been at rest for 15 minutes in a supine position.

other_outcome.measure: Mean QTcF Duration (Fridericia's Correction Formula, QTcF) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Fridericia-corrected QTcF duration was evaluated as part of the 12-lead electrocardiogram. ECGs were recorded after the participant had been at rest for 15 minutes in a supine position.

other_outcome.measure: Mean RR Duration (RRmean) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: RR duration was evaluated as part of the 12-lead electrocardiogram. ECGs were recorded after the participant had been at rest for 15 minutes in a supine position.

other_outcome.measure: Mean Ventricular Rate (VRmean) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
other_outcome.description: Ventricular rate was evaluated as part of the 12-lead electrocardiogram. ECGs were recorded after the participant had been at rest for 15 minutes in a supine position

arm_group.description: Participants received Riociguat orally as a film-coated tablet up to 2.5mg three times daily (tid) (titration between 1.0 mg and 2.5 mg tid based on an individual dose titration (IDT) scheme) for 16 weeks
Participants received Placebo orally as a film-coated tablet three times daily (tid) for 16 weeks

intervention.description: BAY63-2521: 1 mg tid - 2,5 mg tid orally for 16 weeks.
Matching Placebo tid orally for 16 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female patients with CTEPH either inoperable or with persistent or recurrent PH after surgery.
Exclusion Criteria:
- All types of pulmonary hypertension except subtypes 4.1 and 4.2 of the Venice Clinical Classification of Pulmonary Hypertension.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Only subjects with symptomatic chronic thromboembolic pulmonary hypertension (CTEPH) could participate in this study. CTEPH was defined either as inoperable or as persisting or recurrent PH after pulmonary endarterectomy.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 446 subjects were screened in 89 study centers in 26 countries worldwide. 184 of the 446 screened subjects were not randomized (adverse event [1], death [4], protocol violation [164], withdrawal by subject [15]). 262 of the 446 subjects were randomized. 261 of the 262 randomized subjects received study medication.

analysis.groups_desc: Missing values for participants who withdrew/died before 16 weeks were imputed with a worst value of 0m in case of death/clinical worsening without termination visit and with the last observed value otherwise. Comparison was done using analysis of covariance (ANCOVA), with baseline 6MWD as a covariate and treatment group and region as main effects. The primary statistical method was the stratified Wilcoxon test if the Shapiro-Wilk test for normality of residuals was statistically significant.
analysis.p_value_desc: Prespecified significance level for all significance tests was 5%. Primary analysis, due to result of Shapiro-Wilk test.
Additional analysis, due to result of Shapiro-Wilk test.

analysis.groups_desc: Shapiro-Wilk test for normality of ANCOVA residuals.

PVR is derived from the directly measured parameters mean pulmonary arterial pressure (PAPmean) and pulmonary capillary wedge pressure (PCWP), divided by the cardiac output (CO). PVR and PAPmean are acquired during a right heart catheterization. CO is a calculated hemodynamic parameter, too. Formula: PVR = 80*(PAPmean - PCWP)/CO
outcome.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) - a randomized participant was valid for ITT analyses if at least one dose of study medication was administered. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in the analysis of PVR.

It documents the participant's exertion during a physical test. Low values indicate low levels of exertion; high values indicate more intense exertion reported by the participant. The score ranges from 0 ("Nothing at all") to 10 (“Extremely strong – Maximal”).
measure.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) - a randomized participant was valid for ITT analyses if at least one dose of study medication was administered.

analysis.groups_desc: Missing values for participants who withdrew or died before 16 weeks were imputed with a worst value of 10 in case of death or clinical worsening without termination visit and with the last observed value otherwise.
analysis.p_value_desc: Hierarchical testing for secondary efficacy parameters in the order: PVR, NT-proBNP, WHO functional class, Time to clinical worsening, Borg scale, EQ5D, LPH. Nominally significant only due to hierarchical testing.

outcome.title: EQ-5D Utility Score - Change From Baseline to Week 16
outcome.description: EQ-5D utility score is a Quality-of-Life participant reported outcome measure. The utility score is calculated based on five questions concerning problems with mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort and anxiety/depression. An increase in the utility score represents an improvement in quality of life. The score ranges from -0.594 (worst answer in all five questions) to 1 (best answer in all five questions).
outcome.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) - a randomized participant was valid for ITT analyses if at least one dose of study medication was administered. Participants with a missing baseline were excluded from the analysis of the EQ5D utility score.

outcome.title: Cardiac Index (CI) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
outcome.description: The cardiac index (CI) is a calculated hemodynamic parameter. CI is derived from the directly measured parameters cardiac output (CO), divided by the body surface area (BSA). BSA is a calculated parameter, using the subject’s height and weight in the DuBois formula. Formula: BSA = (W [kg]*0.425)*(H [cm]*0.725)*0.007184 (m^2)
outcome.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) - a randomized participant was valid for ITT analyses if at least one dose of study medication was administered. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in the analysis of CI.
